column4: ok then ...I'm trying to find a program ...I moved it but do not remember where ...now I can;t find the folder. I have searched in Nautilus in the home folder, but it doesn;t show up
you might have to run 'updatedb' first
open a terminal and run command
You might try de-installing from the add/remove option in the Applications menu
I got ...cannot open a temporary file for /var/lib/mlocate/mlocate.db
that is what I got when I ran updatedb
right, you have to run "sudo updatedb"
after that, as a user you can locate any file by using the 'localte' command
I just want to make sure I had the info right ...I think you made a typo with locate earlier and wanted to be sure
I might have :) After running the updatedb command, your localte command is: "/usr/bin/locate <string>"
now that I I have found everything that has anything to do with xchat ...how do I kill it all off ...I want to remove everything and start from scratch
I'm not sure, you want to remove all of the xchat software?
well, as raylu pointed out, your settings are in the .xchat directory in your homedirectory. Removing that directory (~/.xchat) might help you
